title: Spinolyp

properties.name: description
properties.value: Spinolyps are small, Dagannoth-like creatures found in the deepest sublevel of Waterbirth Island Dungeon in the same room as the Dagannoth Kings. It is recommended to bring some form of antipoison as they are able to poison. Their Magic attack takes the appearance of Water Strike and is considered ranged-based magic as it rolls against the player's Ranged defence.[1] As such, it will always be more beneficial to use a guthan's platebody over a karil's leathertop, for example. A successful hit by their Magic attack also drains 1 prayer point; this prayer drain effect is halved when using a spectral spirit shield.[2] Their ranged attack is poisonous and resembles the one used by Ranged-using Dagannoth. Each attack can hit up to 10.

SMW Subobject for Suspicious waterImage: File:Placeholder.pngMax hit: 10Name: Suspicious waterExamine: If I didn't know better, I'd swear there's something in there...Combat level: 34Immune to venom: Not immuneIs members only: trueIs variant of: SpinolypHitpoints: 100Uses infobox: MonsterNPC ID: 5946, 5948, 5962Attack style: MeleeRelease date: 7 November 2005Version anchor: Suspicious waterImmune to poison: Not immuneSize: 1

Spinolyps are small, Dagannoth-like creatures found in the deepest sublevel of Waterbirth Island Dungeon in the same room as the Dagannoth Kings. It is recommended to bring some form of antipoison as they are able to poison. Their Magic attack takes the appearance of Water Strike and is considered ranged-based magic as it rolls against the player's Ranged defence.[1] As such, it will always be more beneficial to use a guthan's platebody over a karil's leathertop, for example. A successful hit by their Magic attack also drains 1 prayer point; this prayer drain effect is halved when using a spectral spirit shield.[2] Their ranged attack is poisonous and resembles the one used by Ranged-using Dagannoth. Each attack can hit up to 10.

Spinolyps will turn into level 34 Suspicious water on occasion, and become non-attackable. If the water is adjacent to a player it may deal a rapid inaccurate melee attack. After a while they will emerge again as Spinolyps. If they somehow die as Suspicious water (e.g. venom, projectile fired before transforming), then bones will be dropped.

They never become tolerant to the player.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 3 September 2015. (Archived from the original on 28 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "Both attacks roll the ranged accuracy against your ranged defence, but one deals magic damage and drains prayer."
  2. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 16 February 2017. (Archived from the original on 28 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "[Does the spectral buff include the 1 pray drain from spinolyps?] It does, but it randomly rounds up and down so that on average you get about 50% the drain from before."

'''Spinolyps''' are small, [[Dagannoth]]-like creatures found in the deepest sublevel of [[Waterbirth Island Dungeon]] in the same room as the [[Dagannoth Kings]]. It is recommended to bring some form of [[antipoison]] as they are able to poison. Their Magic attack takes the appearance of [[Water Strike]] and is considered [[Ranged magic|ranged-based magic]] as it rolls against the player's Ranged defence.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/639452580532383744|date=3 September 2015|archiveurl=https://archive.is/eQ07b|archivedate=28 May 2020|quote=Both attacks roll the ranged accuracy against your ranged defence, but one deals magic damage and drains prayer.}} As such, it will always be more beneficial to use a [[guthan's platebody]] over a [[karil's leathertop]], for example. A [[successful hit]] by their Magic attack also drains 1 prayer point; this prayer drain effect is halved when using a [[spectral spirit shield]].{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/832192803232944128|date=16 February 2017|archiveurl=https://archive.is/rFGjR|archivedate=28 May 2020|quote=[Does the spectral buff include the 1 pray drain from spinolyps?] It does, but it randomly rounds up and down so that on average you get about 50% the drain from before.}} Their ranged attack is poisonous and resembles the one used by Ranged-using [[Dagannoth]]. Each attack can hit up to 10.

Spinolyps will turn into level 34 Suspicious water on occasion, and become non-attackable. If the water is adjacent to a player it may deal a rapid inaccurate melee attack. After a while they will emerge again as Spinolyps. If they somehow die as Suspicious water (e.g. [[venom]], projectile fired before transforming), then [[bones]] will be dropped.

They never become [[Tolerance|tolerant]] to the player.
